revised_title: Obituary of George Armand Robert Kon: A Pioneering Organic Chemist
tldr: George Armand Robert Kon was a pioneering organic chemist who made significant contributions to the field. Born in St. Petersburg, Kon's early life was marked by his passion for natural history and butterfly collecting. After studying medicine at Cambridge, he decided to pursue chemistry and worked under Jocelyn Thorpe at the Imperial College of Science and Technology. Kon's research focused on spiro compounds, ring formation, and the Guareschi reaction. He later held the Chair of Chemistry at the Chester Beatty Research Institute, where he continued his work on carcinogenesis and mutagenesis. Kon was a kind and generous scientist, known for his exceptional experimental skills and care in his work.
